Pipelines¶

Load a model for inference¶

You can use the pipeline function to load a model for inference by its name. If you wish to generic Hugging Face model provide the name of a task as the pipeline name along with the model_name argument for the model you wish to load. If the model is private, provide your authentication token with the auth_token argument or, alternatively, you can cache your token by running the scales-nlp configure from command line and instead just use auth_token=True.

pipelines.pipeline(**kwargs)¶

Load a pipeline for a given task.

Parameters:

  • pipeline_name (str) – Name of the pipeline to load

  • model_name – (str, optional) If using a generic task pipeline, must specify a Hugging Face model name

Return type:

BasePipeline

Create custom pipelines¶

You can extend the BasePipeline class to create your own inference pipelines. See the ClassificationPipeline, MultiLabelClassificationPipeline, TokenClassificationPipeline, and SentenceEncodingPipeline for examples.

class scales_nlp.pipelines.BasePipeline(model_name, max_length=512, device=None, use_auth_token=False, **kwargs)¶

Base class for all pipelines.

place_on_device(obj)¶

Method for placing models and tensors on the correct device.

Parameters:

obj (Union[Tensor, Module]) – Object to place on device

Return type:

Union[Tensor, Module]

Returns:

Object on device

get_model_name(model_name, **kwargs)¶

Trivial method for getting the model name. Pipelines that rely on a specific model should override this method.

Parameters:

model_name (str) – Name of the model

Return type:

str

Returns:

Updated of the model

process_inputs(examples)¶

Hook for processing inputs before tokenization.

Parameters:

examples (List[str]) – Input examples

Return type:

List[str]

Returns:

Processed inputs

process_predictions(examples, predictions)¶

Hook for processing predictions before returning them.

Parameters:

  • examples – Input examples

  • predictions – Predictions from model

Returns:

Processed predictions

tokenize(texts)¶

Tokenize method.

Parameters:

texts (List[str]) – List of texts to tokenize

Returns:

Tokenized inputs

generate_batches(examples, batch_size)¶

Generate batches of examples.

Parameters:

  • examples (List) – List of examples

  • batch_size (int) – Batch size

Return type:

List[List]

Returns:

List of batched examples

load_model()¶

Load the model. Must be implemented by all pipelines.

Returns:

Loaded Hugging Face model

batch_predict(inputs, **kwargs)¶

Predict on a batch of inputs. Must be implemented by all pipelines.

Parameters:

inputs – Batch of inputs

Returns:

Predictions

property require_auth_token¶

Override this property to force pipeline to require an auth token.
